keyword: how many calories is in a roll of sushi
title: How Many Calories in a Roll of Sushi?
meta_description: Discover how many calories is in a roll of sushi, including macros like carbs, protein, fat, and tips for variations in this guide.
h1: How Many Calories in a Roll of Sushi?
assumptions: Standard California roll (6 pieces), with sushi rice, nori, imitation crab, avocado, cucumber; no extra sauces.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by type of roll, ingredients, rice portion, and preparation; check restaurant info or labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard roll of sushi contains about 255 kcal, with high carbs from rice and moderate protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add spicy mayo (1 tsp per roll)
Philadelphia roll with real crab and cream cheese (vs. imitation)

faqs.q: How many calories is in a roll of sushi typically?
faqs.a: Around 255 kcal for a standard California roll of 6 pieces.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a sushi roll?
faqs.a: About 38 g carbs, mostly from the seasoned rice.

faqs.q: Is sodium high in sushi rolls?
faqs.a: Yes, often 800 mg or more due to soy sauce and seasonings.

faqs.q: How do different sushi rolls compare in calories?
faqs.a: Veggie rolls are lower (~200 kcal); tempura or fried rolls higher (~400 kcal).

faqs.q: Does the type of fish affect calories in sushi?
faqs.a: Fatty fish like salmon adds more calories than lean tuna; about 20-50 kcal difference per roll.
